data.title: Marriage to Ferdinand of Aragon
data.meta_description: Isabella was named heir to the throne, beginning the search for a husband to lead Spain. No one knew Isabella would become an outstanding leader for Spain and her husband, just an accessory. She...
data.meta_site_name: Queen Isabella: LEADER OF EUROPEAN EXPLORATION AND DOMINATION
data.text:
"Ferdinand of Aragon marries Isabella of Castile in Valladolid, thus beginning a cooperative reign that would unite all the domions of Spain and elevate the nation to a world power."-history.com, 'Ferdinand and Isabella Marry'

“I think it was closer to that [for political reasons]. He [Ferdinand] was a lousy husband. I think she understood the political advantages. At that point in time, if you were a woman, you never really had much choice. You had to help out the family, do what’s best for the family, so in this case, it’s to marry the guy next door.”-Dr.Laurence Marvin, Professor of the Middle Ages at Berry College.

King Ferdinand and Queen Isabella of Spain. [2]

"This map of the kingdoms of the Iberian Peninsula from 1270 to 1492 shows the kingdoms of Castile, Aragon, and Portugal. Adapted from Muir’s Historical Atlas, 1911." [3]

"Ferdinand on the left with Isabella on the right. The inscription above identifies them as "Lord Ferdinand and Lady Isabella, King and Queen of Castille and of Aragon."[4]
